references.paper_title: SNMCF: a scalable nonnegative matrix co-factorization for student cognitive modeling
references.reason: This paper is directly related to the proposed AE-NMCF model and serves as a foundation for the improved method, providing a baseline for comparison and highlighting the advancements in the new model.

references.paper_title: A review of cognitively diagnostic assessment and a summary of psychometric models
references.reason: This review paper provides a comprehensive overview of cognitive diagnostic assessment models (CDMs), which are a crucial part of the context for this research and helps understand the state-of-the-art in student cognitive modeling.

references.paper_title: Factorization techniques for predicting student performance
references.reason: This paper introduces matrix factorization techniques in educational data mining, a core method that underpins the proposed model and provides a basis for the data mining approach.

references.paper_title: Testing the conditional independence and monotonicity assumptions of item response theory
references.reason: This paper introduces the monotonicity principle, which is a fundamental psychometric theory leveraged in this study to enhance the accuracy and interpretability of the student cognitive model.

references.paper_title: A matrix factorization method for mapping items to skills and for enhancing expert-based q-matrices
references.reason: This paper introduces matrix factorization for mapping items to skills, a fundamental concept which is also used in this study, which helps improve the accuracy of knowledge proficiency estimation.
